info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.
info.title: Twilio REST API

parameters.description: The `friendly_name` of the Workspace resources to read. For example `Customer Support` or `2014 Election Campaign`.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Workspace resource. It can be up to 64 characters long. For example: `Customer Support` or `2014 Election Campaign`.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The URL we should call when an event occurs. If provided, the Workspace will publish events to this URL, for example, to collect data for reporting. See [Workspace Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/api/event) for more information.
parameters.name: EventCallbackUrl

parameters.description: The list of Workspace events for which to call event_callback_url. For example if `EventsFilter=task.created,task.canceled,worker.activity.update`, then TaskRouter will call event_callback_url only when a task is created, canceled, or a Worker activity is updated.
parameters.name: EventsFilter

parameters.description: Whether to enable multi-tasking. Can be: `true` to enable multi-tasking, or `false` to disable it. The default is `false`. Multi-tasking allows Workers to handle multiple Tasks simultaneously. When enabled (`true`), each Worker can receive parallel reservations up to the per-channel maximums defined in the Workers section. Otherwise, each Worker will only receive a new reservation when the previous task is completed. Learn more at [Multitasking][https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/multitasking].
parameters.name: MultiTaskEnabled

parameters.description: An available template name. Can be: `NONE` or `FIFO` and the default is `NONE`. Pre-configures the Workspace with the Workflow and Activities specified in the template. `NONE` will create a Workspace with only a set of default activities. `FIFO` will configure TaskRouter with a set of default activities and a single TaskQueue for first-in, first-out distribution, which can be useful when you are getting started with TaskRouter.
parameters.name: Template

parameters.description: The type of TaskQueue to prioritize when Workers are receiving Tasks from both types of TaskQueues. Can be: `LIFO` or `FIFO` and the default is `FIFO`. For more information, see [Queue Ordering][https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/queue-ordering-last-first-out-lifo].
parameters.name: PrioritizeQueueOrder

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity that will be used when new Workers are created in the Workspace.
parameters.name: DefaultActivitySid

parameters.description: The URL we should call when an event occurs. See [Workspace Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/api/event) for more information.
parameters.name: EventCallbackUrl

parameters.description: The list of Workspace events for which to call event_callback_url. For example if `EventsFilter=task.created,task.canceled,worker.activity.update`, then TaskRouter will call event_callback_url only when a task is created, canceled, or a Worker activity is updated.
parameters.name: EventsFilter

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Workspace resource. For example: `Sales Call Center` or `Customer Support Team`.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: Whether to enable multi-tasking. Can be: `true` to enable multi-tasking, or `false` to disable it. The default is `false`. Multi-tasking allows Workers to handle multiple Tasks simultaneously. When enabled (`true`), each Worker can receive parallel reservations up to the per-channel maximums defined in the Workers section. Otherwise, each Worker will only receive a new reservation when the previous task is completed. Learn more at [Multitasking][https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/multitasking].
parameters.name: MultiTaskEnabled

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity that will be assigned to a Worker when a Task reservation times out without a response.
parameters.name: TimeoutActivitySid

parameters.description: The type of TaskQueue to prioritize when Workers are receiving Tasks from both types of TaskQueues. Can be: `LIFO` or `FIFO` and the default is `FIFO`. For more information, see [Queue Ordering][https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/queue-ordering-last-first-out-lifo].
parameters.name: PrioritizeQueueOrder

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Activity resources to read.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The `friendly_name` of the Activity resources to read.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: Whether return only Activity resources that are available or unavailable. A value of `true` returns only available activities. Values of '1' or `yes` also indicate `true`. All other values represent `false` and return activities that are unavailable.
parameters.name: Available

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace that the new Activity belongs to.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Activity resource. It can be up to 64 characters long. These names are used to calculate and expose statistics about Workers, and provide visibility into the state of each Worker. Examples of friendly names include: `on-call`, `break`, and `email`.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: Whether the Worker should be eligible to receive a Task when it occupies the Activity. A value of `true`, `1`, or `yes` specifies the Activity is available. All other values specify that it is not.
parameters.name: Available

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Activity resources to delete.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Activity resources to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Activity resources to update.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Activity resource. It can be up to 64 characters long. These names are used to calculate and expose statistics about Workers, and provide visibility into the state of each Worker. Examples of friendly names include: `on-call`, `break`, and `email`.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: Only include usage that occurred on or before this date, specified in GMT as an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time.
parameters.name: EndDate

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics since this many minutes in the past. The default 15 minutes. This is helpful for displaying statistics for the last 15 minutes, 240 minutes (4 hours), and 480 minutes (8 hours) to see trends.
parameters.name: Minutes

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and later, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
parameters.name: StartDate

parameters.description: Only calculate cumulative statistics on this TaskChannel. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed. For example, `5,30` would show splits of Tasks that were canceled or accepted before and after 5 seconds and before and after 30 seconds. This can be used to show short abandoned Tasks or Tasks that failed to meet an SLA.
parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Events to read. Returns only the Events that pertain to the specified Workspace.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: Only include Events that occurred on or before this date, specified in GMT as an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time.
parameters.name: EndDate

parameters.description: The type of Events to read. Returns only Events of the type specified.
parameters.name: EventType

parameters.description: The period of events to read in minutes. Returns only Events that occurred since this many minutes in the past. The default is `15` minutes.
parameters.name: Minutes

parameters.description: The SID of the Reservation with the Events to read. Returns only Events that pertain to the specified Reservation.
parameters.name: ReservationSid

parameters.description: Only include Events from on or after this date and time, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
parameters.name: StartDate

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskQueue with the Events to read. Returns only the Events that pertain to the specified TaskQueue.
parameters.name: TaskQueueSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Task with the Events to read. Returns only the Events that pertain to the specified Task.
parameters.name: TaskSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Worker with the Events to read. Returns only the Events that pertain to the specified Worker.
parameters.name: WorkerSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workflow with the Events to read. Returns only the Events that pertain to the specified Workflow.
parameters.name: WorkflowSid

parameters.description: The TaskChannel with the Events to read. Returns only the Events that pertain to the specified TaskChannel.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: The SID of the Event resource to read.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Event to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Event resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: Only calculate real-time statistics on this TaskChannel. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics since this many minutes in the past. The default 15 minutes. This is helpful for displaying statistics for the last 15 minutes, 240 minutes (4 hours), and 480 minutes (8 hours) to see trends.
parameters.name: Minutes

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and later, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
parameters.name: StartDate

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and earlier, specified in GMT as an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time.
parameters.name: EndDate

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics on this TaskChannel. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed. For example, `5,30` would show splits of Tasks that were canceled or accepted before and after 5 seconds and before and after 30 seconds. This can be used to show short abandoned Tasks or Tasks that failed to meet an SLA.
parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskChannel to read.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace that the new TaskChannel belongs to.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the TaskChannel. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the TaskChannel, such as `voice` or `sms`.
parameters.name: UniqueName

parameters.description: Whether the TaskChannel should prioritize Workers that have been idle. If `true`, Workers that have been idle the longest are prioritized.
parameters.name: ChannelOptimizedRouting

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskChannel to delete.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskChannel resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskChannel to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskChannel resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskChannel to update.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskChannel resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the TaskChannel. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: Whether the TaskChannel should prioritize Workers that have been idle. If `true`, Workers that have been idle the longest are prioritized.
parameters.name: ChannelOptimizedRouting

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskQueue to read.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The `friendly_name` of the TaskQueue resources to read.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The attributes of the Workers to read. Returns the TaskQueues with Workers that match the attributes specified in this parameter.
parameters.name: EvaluateWorkerAttributes

parameters.description: The SID of the Worker with the TaskQueue resources to read.
parameters.name: WorkerSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace that the new TaskQueue belongs to.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the TaskQueue. For example `Support-Tier 1`, `Sales`, or `Escalation`.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: A string that describes the Worker selection criteria for any Tasks that enter the TaskQueue. For example, `'"language" == "spanish"'`. The default value is `1==1`. If this value is empty, Tasks will wait in the TaskQueue until they are deleted or moved to another TaskQueue. For more information about Worker selection, see [Describing Worker selection criteria](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/api/taskqueues#target-workers).
parameters.name: TargetWorkers

parameters.description: The maximum number of Workers to reserve for the assignment of a Task in the queue. Can be an integer between 1 and 50, inclusive and defaults to 1.
parameters.name: MaxReservedWorkers

parameters.description: How Tasks will be assigned to Workers. Set this parameter to `LIFO` to assign most recently created Task first or FIFO to assign the oldest Task first. Default is `FIFO`. [Click here](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/queue-ordering-last-first-out-lifo) to learn more.
parameters.name: TaskOrder

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity to assign Workers when a task is reserved for them.
parameters.name: ReservationActivitySid

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity to assign Workers when a task is assigned to them.
parameters.name: AssignmentActivitySid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskQueues to read.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and earlier, specified in GMT as an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time.
parameters.name: EndDate

parameters.description: The `friendly_name` of the TaskQueue statistics to read.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics since this many minutes in the past. The default is 15 minutes.
parameters.name: Minutes

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and later, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
parameters.name: StartDate

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics on this TaskChannel. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed.
parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskQueue to delete.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskQueue resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskQueue to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskQueue resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskQueue to update.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskQueue resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the TaskQueue. For example `Support-Tier 1`, `Sales`, or `Escalation`.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: A string describing the Worker selection criteria for any Tasks that enter the TaskQueue. For example '"language" == "spanish"' If no TargetWorkers parameter is provided, Tasks will wait in the queue until they are either deleted or moved to another queue. Additional examples on how to describing Worker selection criteria below.
parameters.name: TargetWorkers

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity to assign Workers when a task is reserved for them.
parameters.name: ReservationActivitySid

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity to assign Workers when a task is assigned for them.
parameters.name: AssignmentActivitySid

parameters.description: The maximum number of Workers to create reservations for the assignment of a task while in the queue. Maximum of 50.
parameters.name: MaxReservedWorkers

parameters.description: How Tasks will be assigned to Workers. Can be: `FIFO` or `LIFO` and the default is `FIFO`. Use `FIFO` to assign the oldest task first and `LIFO` to assign the most recent task first. For more information, see [Queue Ordering](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/queue-ordering-last-first-out-lifo).
parameters.name: TaskOrder

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskQueue to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskQueue for which to fetch statistics.
parameters.name: TaskQueueSid

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and earlier, specified in GMT as an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time.
parameters.name: EndDate

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics since this many minutes in the past. The default is 15 minutes.
parameters.name: Minutes

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and later, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
parameters.name: StartDate

parameters.description: Only calculate cumulative statistics on this TaskChannel. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed.
parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskQueue to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskQueue for which to fetch statistics.
parameters.name: TaskQueueSid

parameters.description: The TaskChannel for which to fetch statistics. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskQueue to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskQueue for which to fetch statistics.
parameters.name: TaskQueueSid

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and earlier, specified in GMT as an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time.
parameters.name: EndDate

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics since this many minutes in the past. The default is 15 minutes.
parameters.name: Minutes

parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and later, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
parameters.name: StartDate

parameters.description: Only calculate real-time and cumulative statistics for the specified TaskChannel. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed.
parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Tasks to read.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The priority value of the Tasks to read. Returns the list of all Tasks in the Workspace with the specified priority.
parameters.name: Priority

parameters.description: The `assignment_status` of the Tasks to read. Can be: `pending`, `reserved`, `assigned`, `canceled`, and `completed`. Returns all Tasks in the Workspace with the specified `assignment_status`.
parameters.name: AssignmentStatus

parameters.description: The SID of the Workflow with the Tasks to read. Returns the Tasks controlled by the Workflow identified by this SID.
parameters.name: WorkflowSid

parameters.description: The friendly name of the Workflow with the Tasks to read. Returns the Tasks controlled by the Workflow identified by this friendly name.
parameters.name: WorkflowName

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskQueue with the Tasks to read. Returns the Tasks waiting in the TaskQueue identified by this SID.
parameters.name: TaskQueueSid

parameters.description: The `friendly_name` of the TaskQueue with the Tasks to read. Returns the Tasks waiting in the TaskQueue identified by this friendly name.
parameters.name: TaskQueueName

parameters.description: The attributes of the Tasks to read. Returns the Tasks that match the attributes specified in this parameter.
parameters.name: EvaluateTaskAttributes

parameters.description: How to order the returned Task resources. y default, Tasks are sorted by ascending DateCreated. This value is specified as: `Attribute:Order`, where `Attribute` can be either `Priority` or `DateCreated` and `Order` can be either `asc` or `desc`. For example, `Priority:desc` returns Tasks ordered in descending order of their Priority. Multiple sort orders can be specified in a comma-separated list such as `Priority:desc,DateCreated:asc`, which returns the Tasks in descending Priority order and ascending DateCreated Order.
parameters.name: Ordering

parameters.description: Whether to read Tasks with addons. If `true`, returns only Tasks with addons. If `false`, returns only Tasks without addons.
parameters.name: HasAddons

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace that the new Task belongs to.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The amount of time in seconds the new task is allowed to live. Can be up to a maximum of 2 weeks (1,209,600 seconds). The default value is 24 hours (86,400 seconds). On timeout, the `task.canceled` event will fire with description `Task TTL Exceeded`.
parameters.name: Timeout

parameters.description: The priority to assign the new task and override the default. When supplied, the new Task will have this priority unless it matches a Workflow Target with a Priority set. When not supplied, the new Task will have the priority of the matching Workflow Target.
parameters.name: Priority

parameters.description: When MultiTasking is enabled, specify the TaskChannel by passing either its `unique_name` or `sid`. Default value is `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: The SID of the Workflow that you would like to handle routing for the new Task. If there is only one Workflow defined for the Workspace that you are posting the new task to, this parameter is optional.
parameters.name: WorkflowSid

parameters.description: A URL-encoded JSON string with the attributes of the new task. This value is passed to the Workflow's `assignment_callback_url` when the Task is assigned to a Worker. For example: `{ "task_type": "call", "twilio_call_sid": "CAxxx", "customer_ticket_number": "12345" }`.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Task to delete.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Task resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Task to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Task resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the Task to update.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Task resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The JSON string that describes the custom attributes of the task.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: The new status of the task. Can be: `canceled`, to cancel a Task that is currently `pending` or `reserved`; `wrapping`, to move the Task to wrapup state; or `completed`, to move a Task to the completed state.
parameters.name: AssignmentStatus

parameters.description: The reason that the Task was canceled or completed. This parameter is required only if the Task is canceled or completed. Setting this value queues the task for deletion and logs the reason.
parameters.name: Reason

parameters.description: The Task's new priority value. When supplied, the Task takes on the specified priority unless it matches a Workflow Target with a Priority set.
parameters.name: Priority

parameters.description: When MultiTasking is enabled, specify the TaskChannel with the task to update. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.
parameters.name: TaskChannel

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskReservation resources to read.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the reserved Task resource with the TaskReservation resources to read.
parameters.name: TaskSid

parameters.description: Returns the list of reservations for a task with a specified ReservationStatus.  Can be: `pending`, `accepted`, `rejected`, or `timeout`.
parameters.name: ReservationStatus

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskReservation resource to fetch.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the reserved Task resource with the TaskReservation resource to fetch.
parameters.name: TaskSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskReservation resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace with the TaskReservation resources to update.
parameters.name: WorkspaceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the reserved Task resource with the TaskReservation resources to update.
parameters.name: TaskSid

parameters.description: The SID of the TaskReservation resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The new status of the reservation. Can be: `pending`, `accepted`, `rejected`, or `timeout`.
parameters.name: ReservationStatus

parameters.description: The new worker activity SID if rejecting a reservation.
parameters.name: WorkerActivitySid

parameters.description: The assignment instruction for reservation.
parameters.name: Instruction

parameters.description: The SID of the Activity resource to start after executing a Dequeue instruction.
parameters.name: DequeuePostWorkActivitySid

parameters.description: The Caller ID of the call to the worker when executing a Dequeue instruction.
parameters.name: DequeueFrom

parameters.description: Whether to record both legs of a call when executing a Dequeue instruction or which leg to record.
parameters.name: DequeueRecord

parameters.description: Timeout for call when executing a Dequeue instruction.
parameters.name: DequeueTimeout

parameters.description: The Contact URI of the worker when executing a Dequeue instruction. Can be the URI of the Twilio Client, the SIP URI for Programmable SIP, or the [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) formatted phone number, depending on the destination.
parameters.name: DequeueTo

parameters.description: The Callback URL for completed call event when executing a Dequeue instruction.
parameters.name: DequeueStatusCallbackUrl

parameters.description: The Caller ID of the outbound call when executing a Call instruction.
parameters.name: CallFrom

parameters.description: Whether to record both legs of a call when executing a Call instruction or which leg to record.
parameters.name: CallRecord

parameters.description: Timeout for call when executing a Call instruction.
parameters.name: CallTimeout

parameters.description: The Contact URI of the worker when executing a Call instruction.  Can be the URI of the Twilio Client, the SIP URI for Programmable SIP, or the [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) formatted phone number, depending on the destination.
parameters.name: CallTo

parameters.description: TwiML URI executed on answering the worker's leg as a result of the Call instruction.
parameters.name: CallUrl

parameters.description: The URL to call  for the completed call event when executing a Call instruction.
parameters.name: CallStatusCallbackUrl

parameters.description: Whether to accept a reservation when executing a Call instruction.
parameters.name: CallAccept

parameters.description: The Call SID of the call parked in the queue when executing a Redirect instruction.
parameters.name: RedirectCallSid

parameters.description: Whether the reservation should be accepted when executing a Redirect instruction.
parameters.name: RedirectAccept

parameters.description: TwiML URI to redirect the call to when executing the Redirect instruction.
parameters.name: RedirectUrl

parameters.description: The Contact URI of the worker when executing a Conference instruction. Can be the URI of the Twilio Client, the SIP URI for Programmable SIP, or the [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) formatted phone number, depending on the destination.
parameters.name: To

parameters.description: The Caller ID of the call to the worker when executing a Conference instruction.
parameters.name: From

parameters.description: The URL we should call using the `status_callback_method` to send status information to your application.
parameters.name: StatusCallback

parameters.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `status_callback`. Can be: `POST` or `GET` and the default is `POST`.
parameters.name: StatusCallbackMethod

parameters.description: The call progress events that we will send to `status_callback`. Can be: `initiated`, `ringing`, `answered`, or `completed`.
parameters.name: StatusCallbackEvent

parameters.description: Timeout for call when executing a Conference instruction.
parameters.name: Timeout

parameters.description: Whether to record the participant and their conferences, including the time between conferences. The default is `false`.
parameters.name: Record

parameters.description: Whether the agent is muted in the conference. The default is `false`.
parameters.name: Muted

parameters.description: Whether to play a notification beep when the participant joins or when to play a beep. Can be: `true`, `false`, `onEnter`, or `onExit`. The default value is `true`.
parameters.name: Beep

parameters.description: Whether to start the conference when the participant joins, if it has not already started. The default is `true`. If `false` and the conference has not started, the participant is muted and hears background music until another participant starts the conference.
parameters.name: StartConferenceOnEnter

parameters.description: Whether to end the conference when the agent leaves.
parameters.name: EndConferenceOnExit

parameters.description: The URL we should call using the `wait_method` for the music to play while participants are waiting for the conference to start. The default value is the URL of our standard hold music. [Learn more about hold music](https://www.twilio.com/labs/twimlets/holdmusic).
parameters.name: WaitUrl

parameters.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `wait_url`. Can be `GET` or `POST` and the default is `POST`. When using a static audio file, this should be `GET` so that we can cache the file.
parameters.name: WaitMethod

parameters.description: Whether to allow an agent to hear the state of the outbound call, including ringing or disconnect messages. The default is `true`.
parameters.name: EarlyMedia

parameters.description: The maximum number of participants in the conference. Can be a positive integer from `2` to `250`. The default value is `250`.
parameters.name: MaxParticipants

parameters.description: The URL we should call using the `conference_status_callback_method` when the conference events in `conference_status_callback_event` occur. Only the value set by the first participant to join the conference is used. Subsequent `conference_status_callback` values are ignored.
parameters.name: ConferenceStatusCallback

parameters.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `conference_status_callback`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and defaults to `POST`.
parameters.name: ConferenceStatusCallbackMethod

parameters.description: The conference status events that we will send to `conference_status_callback`. Can be: `start`, `end`, `join`, `leave`, `mute`, `hold`, `speaker`.
parameters.name: ConferenceStatusCallbackEvent

parameters.description: Whether to record the conference the participant is joining or when to record the conference. Can be: `true`, `false`, `record-from-start`, and `do-not-record`. The default value is `false`.
parameters.name: ConferenceRecord

parameters.description: How to trim the leading and trailing silence from your recorded conference audio files. Can be: `trim-silence` or `do-not-trim` and defaults to `trim-silence`.
parameters.name: ConferenceTrim

parameters.description: The recording channels for the final recording. Can be: `mono` or `dual` and the default is `mono`.
parameters.name: RecordingChannels

parameters.description: The URL that we should call using the `recording_status_callback_method` when the recording status changes.
parameters.name: RecordingStatusCallback

parameters.description: The HTTP method we should use when we call `recording_status_callback`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and defaults to `POST`.
parameters.name: RecordingStatusCallbackMethod

parameters.description: The URL we should call using the `conference_recording_status_callback_method` when the conference recording is available.
parameters.name: ConferenceRecordingStatusCallback

parameters.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `conference_recording_status_callback`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and defaults to `POST`.
parameters.name: ConferenceRecordingStatusCallbackMethod

parameters.description: The [region](https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223132167-How-global-low-latency-routing-and-region-selection-work-for-conferences-and-Client-calls) where we should mix the recorded audio. Can be:`us1`, `ie1`, `de1`, `sg1`, `br1`, `au1`, or `jp1`.
parameters.name: Region

parameters.description: The SIP username used for authentication.
parameters.name: SipAuthUsername

parameters.description: The SIP password for authentication.
parameters.name: SipAuthPassword

parameters.description: The Call progress events sent via webhooks as a result of a Dequeue instruction.
parameters.name: DequeueStatusCallbackEvent

parameters.description: The new worker activity SID after executing a Conference instruction.
parameters.name: PostWorkActivitySid

parameters.description: The Supervisor mode when executing the Supervise instruction.
parameters.name: SupervisorMode

parameters.description: The Supervisor SID/URI when executing the Supervise instruction.
parameters.name: Supervisor

parameters.description: Whether to end the conference when the customer leaves.
parameters.name: EndConferenceOnCustomerExit

parameters.description: Whether to play a notification beep when the customer joins.
parameters.name: BeepOnCustomerEntrance

If not provided, the new Worker's initial state is the `default_activity_sid` configured on the Workspace.

parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed. For example, `5,30` would show splits of Tasks that were canceled or accepted before and after 5 seconds and before and after 30 seconds. This can be used to show short abandoned Tasks or Tasks that failed to meet an SLA.
parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime
